 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1342124: Security: A website is able to modify the address bar displaying a different domain
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1342124: Security: A website is able to modify the address bar displaying a different domain
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A scammer website was able to display the amazon logo and the text<span class="line"><!---->A scammer website was able to display the amazon logo and the text<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in the Chrome address bar. Icons on the right are obscured.<span class="line"><!----> in the Chrome address bar. Icons on the right are obscured.<!----></span><br>It looks like it's related to page icons or the certificate.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like it's related to page icons or the certificate.<!----></span><br>The<span class="line"><!---->The<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> text is text - it is selectable. Right click does not work anywhere in the address bar.<span class="line"><!----> text is text - it is selectable. Right click does not work anywhere in the address bar.<!----></span><br><br>The site is the classic scam where you win an iPhone and just have to pay for shipping. The loading was blocked by my antivirus and the request timed out while I was checking.<span class="line"><!---->The site is the classic scam where you win an iPhone and just have to pay for shipping. The loading was blocked by my antivirus and the request timed out while I was checking.<!----></span><br><br>I'm chasing this waste of carbon for a second day. This exploit is from today!<span class="line"><!---->I'm chasing this waste of carbon for a second day. This exploit is from today!<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.66 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.66 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System:Windows 11 Pro, Version 21H2,OS build	22000.778<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:Windows 11 Pro, Version 21H2,OS build	22000.778<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>The site exploiting the bug is: <span class="line"><!---->The site exploiting the bug is: <!----></span><br>https://qqwnlw.blowrestcold.buzz/nodbpmeg/?u=04kktee&o=12ppt01&f=1&sid=t..<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://qqwnlw.blowrestcold.buzz/nodbpmeg/?u=04kktee&amp;o=12ppt01&amp;f=1&amp;sid=t.."><!---->https://qqwnlw.blowrestcold.buzz/nodbpmeg/?u=04kktee&amp;o=12ppt01&amp;f=1&amp;sid=t..<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> (very long, please see the attachment). Trying to open the page a second time with this URL produces a "Forbidden" response.<span class="line"><!----> (very long, please see the attachment). Trying to open the page a second time with this URL produces a "Forbidden" response.<!----></span><br><br>There may be an additional bug being exploited, because this domain appears to be invalid.<span class="line"><!---->There may be an additional bug being exploited, because this domain appears to be invalid.<!----></span><br>I'm attaching the site saved as a single file. Hope this helps, because you are unlikely to be able to open the site.<span class="line"><!---->I'm attaching the site saved as a single file. Hope this helps, because you are unlikely to be able to open the site.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Ilian Tzankov<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ilian Tzankov<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Opening the mhtml file from disk does not reproduce the issue, the URL is the file:// path. Trying to sort out how to serve an mhtml file locally.<span class="line"><!---->Opening the mhtml file from disk does not reproduce the issue, the URL is the file:// path. Trying to sort out how to serve an mhtml file locally.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

I'm not sure what went wrong here.<span class="line"><!---->You're not supposed to be able to load MHTML over the network for this reason (because MHTML files can specify a Location: header).         FWIW, there are tests that reinforce the claim from <span class="line"><!---->FWIW, there are tests that reinforce the claim from <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> that one shouldn't be able to load MHTML over the network:<span class="line"><!----> that one shouldn't be able to load MHTML over the network:<!----></span><br><br>$ out/rel/content_browsertests --gtest_list_tests --gtest_filter=*MhtmlLoading*<span class="line"><!---->$ out/rel/content_browsertests --gtest_list_tests --gtest_filter=*MhtmlLoading*<!----></span><br>MhtmlLoadingTest.  # TypeParam =<span class="line"><!---->MhtmlLoadingTest.  # TypeParam =<!----></span><br>  AllowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromFile  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  AllowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromFile  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  AllowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromFile  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  AllowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromFile  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  DisallowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  DisallowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822Iframe  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822Iframe  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br><br>The tests were added in <span class="line"><!---->The tests were added in <!----></span>r848740<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/848740"><!---->r848740<!----></a> which tweaked the iframe/browser-side blocking from <span class="line"><!----> which tweaked the iframe/browser-side blocking from <!----></span>r818878<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/818878"><!---->r818878<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>I also found `kAllowListSchemesToRenderingMhtml` from <span class="line"><!---->I also found `kAllowListSchemesToRenderingMhtml` from <!----></span>r739551<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/739551"><!---->r739551<!----></a> which restricts the schemes to file:// and content://.<span class="line"><!----> which restricts the schemes to file:// and content://.<!----></span><br><br><br>Granted, there is also ChromeContentBrowserClient::AllowRenderingMhtmlOverHttp, but it seems to be quite a stretch that an attacker would be able to trigger loading of an offline copy of a page - it seems to require: 1) saving attacker-controller MHTML as an offline page, 2) going offline.<span class="line"><!---->Granted, there is also ChromeContentBrowserClient::AllowRenderingMhtmlOverHttp, but it seems to be quite a stretch that an attacker would be able to trigger loading of an offline copy of a page - it seems to require: 1) saving attacker-controller MHTML as an offline page, 2) going offline.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I hypothesize that this bug is unrelated to MHTML at all - the reporter just happened to use the MHTML format when saving the contents of the malicious page.  And it is possible that the MHTML contents contain only the body of the final page - e.g. the MHTML probably doesn't capture the sequences of navigations that may have led to the URL/omnibox spoof.<span class="line"><!---->I hypothesize that this bug is unrelated to MHTML at all - the reporter just happened to use the MHTML format when saving the contents of the malicious page.  And it is possible that the MHTML contents contain only the body of the final page - e.g. the MHTML probably doesn't capture the sequences of navigations that may have led to the URL/omnibox spoof.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I looked inside the archive. There are no script. That's probably because the MHTML serializer do not include script. I only see the work "amazon" twice in some <p> and <span> element.<span class="line"><!---->I looked inside the archive. There are no script. That's probably because the MHTML serializer do not include script. I only see the work "amazon" twice in some &lt;p&gt; and &lt;span&gt; element.<!----></span><br><br>I don't believe the MHTML archive contains useful informations. We need to be able to load the real website and download the javascript it contains.<span class="line"><!---->I don't believe the MHTML archive contains useful informations.         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342124#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 11, 2022, 12:41 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        I was able to access the phishing page, but couldn't reproduce the address bar spoofing. Also, the (slightly obfuscated) JavaScript on the page didn't seem to contain anything spoofing-related.<span class="line"><!---->I was able to access the phishing page, but couldn't reproduce the address bar spoofing. Also, the (slightly obfuscated) JavaScript on the page didn't seem to contain anything spoofing-related.<!----></span><br><br>Here are a few observations:<span class="line"><!---->Here are a few observations:<!----></span><br><br>- A lot of address bar spoofing bugs result from desynchronization between the active navigation entry and the currently rendered page. I’m fairly confident this isn't one of them because of the capital "A" in "Amazon". NavigationEntry URIs are properly canonicalized.<span class="line"><!---->- A lot of address bar spoofing bugs result from desynchronization between the active navigation entry and the currently rendered page. I’m fairly confident this isn't one of them because of the capital "A" in "Amazon". NavigationEntry URIs are properly canonicalized.<!----></span><br>- I don't think this is a case of a fake address bar being rendered in front of the real one because the "bookmark" button is missing. Otherwise the phishing page would have to determine the exact width of the real address bar to cover it. That would be quite difficult to achieve because the width depends on the number of active extension icons, and hiding the button doesn't benefit the attacker in any way.<span class="line"><!---->- I don't think this is a case of a fake address bar being rendered in front of the real one because the "bookmark" button is missing. Otherwise the phishing page would have to determine the exact width of the real address bar to cover it. That would be quite difficult to achieve because the width depends on the number of active extension icons, and hiding the button doesn't benefit the attacker in any way.<!----></span><br>- Chrome never shows the website icon to the left of the address bar for a loaded page. Instead, it displays the HTTPS status there. However, the browser does show website icons for *Omnibox website suggestions*.<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome never shows the website icon to the left of the address bar for a loaded page. Instead, it displays the HTTPS status there. However, the browser does show website icons for *Omnibox website suggestions*.<!----></span><br><br>To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<span class="line"><!---->To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<!----></span><br><br>1. Type<span class="line"><!---->1. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox.<!----></span><br>2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<span class="line"><!---->2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<!----></span><br>3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<!----></span><br>4. Type<span class="line"><!---->4. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox again.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox again.<!----></span><br>5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<!----></span><br><br>You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342124#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 11, 2022, 5:26 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Re c#29,<span class="line"><!---->Re c#29,<!----></span><br><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br>To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<span class="line"><!---->To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<!----></span><br><br>1. Type<span class="line"><!---->1. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox.<!----></span><br>2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<span class="line"><!---->2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<!----></span><br>3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<!----></span><br>4. Type<span class="line"><!---->4. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox again.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox again.<!----></span><br>5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<!----></span><br><br>You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<!----></span><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br><br>Yes, doing those steps 1-5 would reproduce the screenshot. Steps 1-2 could be skipped if the attacker assumes the user has done that previously. I would assume that if an attack were doing this, they would have used a lower case 'a' to make it look more natural. This theory could be verified by selecting the omnibox and pressing escape. If the text changes, then it does in fact contain temporary user input or an autocomplete suggestions.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, doing those steps 1-5 would reproduce the screenshot. Steps 1-2 could be skipped if the attacker assumes the user has done that previously. I would assume that if an attack were doing this, they would have used a lower case 'a' to make it look more natural. This theory could be verified by selecting the omnibox and pressing escape. If the text changes, then it does in fact contain temporary user input or an autocomplete suggestions.<!----></span><br><br>I can't reach the site (I get 'This site can’t be reached') to verify if that's the case.<span class="line"><!---->I can't reach the site (I get 'This site can’t be reached') to verify if that's the case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");

 }
 }
 });

    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {

      text-align: left;
    }

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          bottom: 1em;

          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-header></mr-header>

      opacity: .75;
    }

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1342124: Security: A website is able to modify the address bar displaying a different domain
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1342124: Security: A website is able to modify the address bar displaying a different domain
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A scammer website was able to display the amazon logo and the text<span class="line"><!---->A scammer website was able to display the amazon logo and the text<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in the Chrome address bar. Icons on the right are obscured.<span class="line"><!----> in the Chrome address bar. Icons on the right are obscured.<!----></span><br>It looks like it's related to page icons or the certificate.<span class="line"><!---->It looks like it's related to page icons or the certificate.<!----></span><br>The<span class="line"><!---->The<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> text is text - it is selectable. Right click does not work anywhere in the address bar.<span class="line"><!----> text is text - it is selectable. Right click does not work anywhere in the address bar.<!----></span><br><br>The site is the classic scam where you win an iPhone and just have to pay for shipping. The loading was blocked by my antivirus and the request timed out while I was checking.<span class="line"><!---->The site is the classic scam where you win an iPhone and just have to pay for shipping. The loading was blocked by my antivirus and the request timed out while I was checking.<!----></span><br><br>I'm chasing this waste of carbon for a second day. This exploit is from today!<span class="line"><!---->I'm chasing this waste of carbon for a second day. This exploit is from today!<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.66 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 103.0.5060.66 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System:Windows 11 Pro, Version 21H2,OS build	22000.778<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:Windows 11 Pro, Version 21H2,OS build	22000.778<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>The site exploiting the bug is: <span class="line"><!---->The site exploiting the bug is: <!----></span><br>https://qqwnlw.blowrestcold.buzz/nodbpmeg/?u=04kktee&o=12ppt01&f=1&sid=t..<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://qqwnlw.blowrestcold.buzz/nodbpmeg/?u=04kktee&amp;o=12ppt01&amp;f=1&amp;sid=t.."><!---->https://qqwnlw.blowrestcold.buzz/nodbpmeg/?u=04kktee&amp;o=12ppt01&amp;f=1&amp;sid=t..<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> (very long, please see the attachment). Trying to open the page a second time with this URL produces a "Forbidden" response.<span class="line"><!----> (very long, please see the attachment). Trying to open the page a second time with this URL produces a "Forbidden" response.<!----></span><br><br>There may be an additional bug being exploited, because this domain appears to be invalid.<span class="line"><!---->There may be an additional bug being exploited, because this domain appears to be invalid.<!----></span><br>I'm attaching the site saved as a single file. Hope this helps, because you are unlikely to be able to open the site.<span class="line"><!---->I'm attaching the site saved as a single file. Hope this helps, because you are unlikely to be able to open the site.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Ilian Tzankov<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ilian Tzankov<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        If somebody knows how is it possible for me to resolve this hostname, even though icann does not know what registrar handles the domain and lets me know, I'll be very grateful!         Opening the mhtml file from disk does not reproduce the issue, the URL is the file:// path. Trying to sort out how to serve an mhtml file locally.<span class="line"><!---->Opening the mhtml file from disk does not reproduce the issue, the URL is the file:// path. Trying to sort out how to serve an mhtml file locally.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

I'm not sure what went wrong here.<span class="line"><!---->You're not supposed to be able to load MHTML over the network for this reason (because MHTML files can specify a Location: header).         FWIW, there are tests that reinforce the claim from <span class="line"><!---->FWIW, there are tests that reinforce the claim from <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> that one shouldn't be able to load MHTML over the network:<span class="line"><!----> that one shouldn't be able to load MHTML over the network:<!----></span><br><br>$ out/rel/content_browsertests --gtest_list_tests --gtest_filter=*MhtmlLoading*<span class="line"><!---->$ out/rel/content_browsertests --gtest_list_tests --gtest_filter=*MhtmlLoading*<!----></span><br>MhtmlLoadingTest.  # TypeParam =<span class="line"><!---->MhtmlLoadingTest.  # TypeParam =<!----></span><br>  AllowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromFile  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  AllowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromFile  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  AllowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromFile  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  AllowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromFile  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  DisallowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  DisallowRenderMultipartRelatedPageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822PageFromHTTP  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br>  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822Iframe  # GetParam() =<span class="line"><!---->  DisallowRenderMessageRfc822Iframe  # GetParam() =<!----></span><br><br>The tests were added in <span class="line"><!---->The tests were added in <!----></span>r848740<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/848740"><!---->r848740<!----></a> which tweaked the iframe/browser-side blocking from <span class="line"><!----> which tweaked the iframe/browser-side blocking from <!----></span>r818878<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/818878"><!---->r818878<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>I also found `kAllowListSchemesToRenderingMhtml` from <span class="line"><!---->I also found `kAllowListSchemesToRenderingMhtml` from <!----></span>r739551<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/739551"><!---->r739551<!----></a> which restricts the schemes to file:// and content://.<span class="line"><!----> which restricts the schemes to file:// and content://.<!----></span><br><br><br>Granted, there is also ChromeContentBrowserClient::AllowRenderingMhtmlOverHttp, but it seems to be quite a stretch that an attacker would be able to trigger loading of an offline copy of a page - it seems to require: 1) saving attacker-controller MHTML as an offline page, 2) going offline.<span class="line"><!---->Granted, there is also ChromeContentBrowserClient::AllowRenderingMhtmlOverHttp, but it seems to be quite a stretch that an attacker would be able to trigger loading of an offline copy of a page - it seems to require: 1) saving attacker-controller MHTML as an offline page, 2) going offline.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I hypothesize that this bug is unrelated to MHTML at all - the reporter just happened to use the MHTML format when saving the contents of the malicious page.  And it is possible that the MHTML contents contain only the body of the final page - e.g. the MHTML probably doesn't capture the sequences of navigations that may have led to the URL/omnibox spoof.<span class="line"><!---->I hypothesize that this bug is unrelated to MHTML at all - the reporter just happened to use the MHTML format when saving the contents of the malicious page.  And it is possible that the MHTML contents contain only the body of the final page - e.g. the MHTML probably doesn't capture the sequences of navigations that may have led to the URL/omnibox spoof.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I looked inside the archive. There are no script. That's probably because the MHTML serializer do not include script. I only see the work "amazon" twice in some <p> and <span> element.<span class="line"><!---->I looked inside the archive. There are no script. That's probably because the MHTML serializer do not include script. I only see the work "amazon" twice in some &lt;p&gt; and &lt;span&gt; element.<!----></span><br><br>I don't believe the MHTML archive contains useful informations. We need to be able to load the real website and download the javascript it contains.<span class="line"><!---->I don't believe the MHTML archive contains useful informations.         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342124#c29">Comment 29<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 11, 2022, 12:41 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        I was able to access the phishing page, but couldn't reproduce the address bar spoofing. Also, the (slightly obfuscated) JavaScript on the page didn't seem to contain anything spoofing-related.<span class="line"><!---->I was able to access the phishing page, but couldn't reproduce the address bar spoofing. Also, the (slightly obfuscated) JavaScript on the page didn't seem to contain anything spoofing-related.<!----></span><br><br>Here are a few observations:<span class="line"><!---->Here are a few observations:<!----></span><br><br>- A lot of address bar spoofing bugs result from desynchronization between the active navigation entry and the currently rendered page. I’m fairly confident this isn't one of them because of the capital "A" in "Amazon". NavigationEntry URIs are properly canonicalized.<span class="line"><!---->- A lot of address bar spoofing bugs result from desynchronization between the active navigation entry and the currently rendered page. I’m fairly confident this isn't one of them because of the capital "A" in "Amazon". NavigationEntry URIs are properly canonicalized.<!----></span><br>- I don't think this is a case of a fake address bar being rendered in front of the real one because the "bookmark" button is missing. Otherwise the phishing page would have to determine the exact width of the real address bar to cover it. That would be quite difficult to achieve because the width depends on the number of active extension icons, and hiding the button doesn't benefit the attacker in any way.<span class="line"><!---->- I don't think this is a case of a fake address bar being rendered in front of the real one because the "bookmark" button is missing. Otherwise the phishing page would have to determine the exact width of the real address bar to cover it. That would be quite difficult to achieve because the width depends on the number of active extension icons, and hiding the button doesn't benefit the attacker in any way.<!----></span><br>- Chrome never shows the website icon to the left of the address bar for a loaded page. Instead, it displays the HTTPS status there. However, the browser does show website icons for *Omnibox website suggestions*.<span class="line"><!---->- Chrome never shows the website icon to the left of the address bar for a loaded page. Instead, it displays the HTTPS status there. However, the browser does show website icons for *Omnibox website suggestions*.<!----></span><br><br>To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<span class="line"><!---->To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<!----></span><br><br>1. Type<span class="line"><!---->1. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox.<!----></span><br>2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<span class="line"><!---->2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<!----></span><br>3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<!----></span><br>4. Type<span class="line"><!---->4. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox again.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox again.<!----></span><br>5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<!----></span><br><br>You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342124#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 11, 2022, 5:26 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Re c#29,<span class="line"><!---->Re c#29,<!----></span><br><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br>To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<span class="line"><!---->To get a virtually pixel-perfect reproduction of the address bar in the screenshot, you need to:<!----></span><br><br>1. Type<span class="line"><!---->1. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox.<!----></span><br>2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<span class="line"><!---->2. Press Enter to create a new history entry.<!----></span><br>3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<span class="line"><!---->3. Open a new tab with any non-Amazon page.<!----></span><br>4. Type<span class="line"><!---->4. Type<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Amazon.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://Amazon.com"><!---->Amazon.com<!----></a> in Omnibox again.<span class="line"><!----> in Omnibox again.<!----></span><br>5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->5. Click anywhere on the page to remove the focus from Omnibox.<!----></span><br><br>You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->You'll get all the key elements: the website icon, the capitalized text, and the lack of address bar buttons. Therefore, I think the most likely explanation is that the bug allows the attacker to directly change the search query text in Omnibox.<!----></span><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br><br>Yes, doing those steps 1-5 would reproduce the screenshot. Steps 1-2 could be skipped if the attacker assumes the user has done that previously. I would assume that if an attack were doing this, they would have used a lower case 'a' to make it look more natural. This theory could be verified by selecting the omnibox and pressing escape. If the text changes, then it does in fact contain temporary user input or an autocomplete suggestions.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, doing those steps 1-5 would reproduce the screenshot. Steps 1-2 could be skipped if the attacker assumes the user has done that previously. I would assume that if an attack were doing this, they would have used a lower case 'a' to make it look more natural. This theory could be verified by selecting the omnibox and pressing escape. If the text changes, then it does in fact contain temporary user input or an autocomplete suggestions.<!----></span><br><br>I can't reach the site (I get 'This site can’t be reached') to verify if that's the case.<span class="line"><!---->I can't reach the site (I get 'This site can’t be reached') to verify if that's the case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
